alert.note: Alert for Northeast Mountains; Okanogan Highlands; Spokane Area; Upper Columbia Basin (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 29 at 1:11PM PDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Lincoln, southwestern Stevens and southwestern Ferry Counties through 145 PM PDT... At 111 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 26 miles northwest of Davenport, or 55 miles northwest of Cheney, moving north at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Davenport, Lincoln, Wilbur, Sprague, Harrington, Creston, Govan, Coffeepot Lake, Miles, Telford, Rocklyn, Sherman, Bluestem, and Keller. This includes the following highways... Interstate 90 in Washington between mile markers 244 and 245. U.S. Highway 2 in Washington between mile markers 216 and 254. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Northeast Mountains; Okanogan Highlands; Spokane Area; Upper Columbia Basin
